official-title.#text:
To amend title 5, United States Code, to establish
		  certain procedures for conducting in-person or telephonic interactions by
		  Executive branch employees with individuals, and for other
		  purposes.

the

header.#text:
Procedures for
				in-person and telephonic interactions conducted by executive branch
				employees

text.#text:
For
				purposes of this section—

term.#tail:
means by telephone or other similar electronic device;
				and

text.#text: the term

term.#tail:
means each of the several States, the District of Columbia,
				and any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States.

text.#text: the term

Any employee of an Executive agency who is conducting
				an in-person or a telephonic interview, audit, investigation, inspection, or
				other official in-person or telephonic interaction with an individual, relating
				to a possible or alleged violation of any Federal statute or regulation that
				could result in the imposition of a fine, forfeiture of property, civil
				monetary penalty, or criminal penalty against, or the collection of an unpaid
				tax, fine, or penalty from, such individual or a business owned or operated by
				such individual, shall allow such individual to make an audio recording of such
				in-person or telephonic interaction at the individual’s own expense and with
				the individual’s own equipment.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may record that interaction if such employee—

text.#text:
Any employee of an Executive agency that is
				conducting an in-person or a telephonic interaction described in

informs the
				individual of such recording prior to or at the initiation of the in-person or
				telephonic interaction; and

upon request of
				the individual, provides the individual with a transcript or copy of such
				recording, but only if the individual provides reimbursement for the cost of
				the transcription and reproduction of such transcript or copy.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, provide to the individual a verbal or written notice of the
				individual’s rights under this section.

header.#text:
Classified

text.#text:
This section
				shall not apply to any in-person or telephonic interaction—

that is likely to
				include the discussion of classified material;

that is likely to
